definitions.definition: A photograph , especially one taken quickly or in a sudden moment of opportunity.
examples: He carried a snapshot of his daughter.

definitions.definition: A glimpse of something; a portrayal of something at a moment in time.
examples: The article offered a snapshot of life in that region.

definitions.definition: A file or set of files captured at a particular time, often capable of being reloaded to restore the earlier state.
examples: This game is so hard that I find myself taking a snapshot every few seconds in case I get killed.

definitions.definition: A quick, unplanned or unexpected shot .
A quick offhand shot, made without deliberately taking aim over the sights.

main_definition: A photograph , especially one taken quickly or in a sudden moment of opportunity.
secondary_definitions: A glimpse of something; a portrayal of something at a moment in time.
( computing ) A file or set of files captured at a particular time, often capable of being reloaded to restore the earlier state.
( soccer ) A quick, unplanned or unexpected shot .
( firearms ) A quick offhand shot, made without deliberately taking aim over the sights.
